thread.title: RatnerPrestia Welcomes New Shareholder Wm Jackson Matney Jr. to its Washington, D.C. Office

author: cbs8
title: RatnerPrestia Welcomes New Shareholder Wm Jackson Matney Jr. to its Washington, D.C. Office
text:
RatnerPrestia is pleased to announce that Wm Jackson Matney Jr. has joined its Washington, DC office as a Shareholder
Washington, DC (PRWEB) October 22, 2015
RatnerPrestia is pleased to announce that Wm Jackson Matney Jr. has joined its Washington, DC office as a Shareholder. RatnerPrestia Chief Executive Officer, Jonathan H. Spadt , notes, “We are particularly pleased with Jack’s extensive litigation experience. His pragmatic approach to resolving IP disputes will add to our growing stable of talented lawyers. And perhaps most importantly, his energy and talents will really mesh with our entire team of exceptional people.”
Jack will focus his practice on intellectual property (IP) litigation and prosecution, with a particular emphasis in the area of patents. A licensed professional engineer in Virginia, Matney previously worked as an engineer at The Dow Chemical Company. A former examiner for the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office, Matney’s practice covers an array of technical subjects and his experience includes automotive and manufacturing, technologies relating to textiles, narrow elastics, dye formulations, laser treatments, sheet metal processing, catalysts, thermoplastics and air and water pollution treatment devices.
Matney is admitted to practice in the District of Columbia and Virginia, as well as the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office. He earned his J.D. degree from George Washington University Law School, and B.S. from the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.
RatnerPrestia is a law firm expert in all things IP. The Firm handles procurement, enforcement, licensing, commercialization, global strategic IP planning, and all related business aspects of IP. We have attorneys experienced and successful in all relevant U.S. agencies and tribunals, including the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office, The International Trade Commission, and Federal Courts, both trial and appellate. With clients based around the world, RP understands that IP is global. For additional information, visit http://www.RatnerPrestia.com .
 //www.prweb.com/releases/2015/10/prweb13035381.htm
